Dudash is Assistant Professor of French and Director of the Medieval and Early Modern Studies Program at Utah State University. The recipient of awards from the Andrew Mellon and Lillian B. Lawler foundations, she has published articles on the political works of Eustache Deschamps and Christine de Pizan. Her current research projects include a book on the emerging role of the poète engagé in late medieval France, and other, interdisciplinary studies of the vices, the tavern, and astrology in medieval French literature and culture

note: and of Dummett: Philosophy of Language (Cambridge: Polity, 2001). She has published numerous articles in philosophical and feminist journals.
title: Karen Green is Senior Lecturer in Philosophy at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia, where she teaches, among other things, courses on feminist philosophy, philosophy of language and existentialism. She is the author of The Woman of Reason: Feminism, Humanism and Political Thought
